lead_paragraph: John Force was able to stand and shuffle his feet yesterday, pronouncing himself “lucky to have my legs” a day after a wreck at the O’Reilly N.H.R.A. Fall Nationals in Ennis, Tex., hospitalized him. Force had a compound fracture of his left ankle, a lacerated right knee, a dislocated left wrist and abrasions on two fingers on his right hand. He had screws inserted into his ankle and temporary pins placed in his wrist, a spokesman for John Force Racing said.
